name: UpyaTech
slogan: Upya develops CRM software for asset distributors in Africa
description:
Upya specialises in CRM software for PAYG (pay-as-you-go) asset distribution companies in Africa. 

Upya provides the software tools for PAYG companies to manage their operations and to reach more end-users with their products. Our distributor client end-users are underserved African populations and our clients products help to accelerate fossil fuel displacement and bring sustainable electricity to the bottom-of-the-pyramid
For our PAYG asset distributor clients: 

•	The flexible Upya web platform is used by HQ to manage and analyse sales and distribution channels, track payments and manage customer communication tools
•	The easy-to-use Upya mobile app is used by agents to manage sales and repayments by registering new end-users, tracking payments and monitoring end-user payment status. 

These features help PAYG asset distributors to increase sales, lower operating costs, and create a more satisfied end-user base.
marketTags: B2B · SaaS · Mobile · Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning

jobs.title: Project Manager
jobs.description:
Are you looking for a new project management opportunity with a high degree of responsibility within a fast-growing start-up? 
Are you passionate about making a positive impact in the developing world?  
If you answered yes to the above, then the Project Manager position at Upya may be a good fit for you. This is a permanent role based in London. 

What does the role involve? 
We are looking for a Project Manager to operate alongside our leadership team in London and to be responsible for the management of a fast-paced and innovative project in Kenya that is designed to reduce the financial and contractual frictions standing in the way of the electrification of Kenya by giving a wider consumer base access to cheaper, greener and more reliable electricity.
This is an opportunity for someone to manage the end-to-end project delivery process and overall leadership and coordination efforts with our project partners in Kenya. 
The project manager will be responsible for executing on the project plan and putting in place the required reporting and monitoring tools to assess progress against targets across a number of technical and commercial deliverables. The project manager will be responsible for managing the budget and all documentation across a number of modules and reporting to key stakeholders. 
In addition, the project manager will have the opportunity to support business development activities such as sourcing new clients and managing our existing clients in East Africa. This will require a degree of research and keeping abreast of industry challenges and trends to offer expert solutions to client needs. 
Ideally, the candidate will have experience of working with clients in the developing world. Technical agility to adapt between different disciplines is a requirement as well as being able to learn quickly and being comfortable working with new technology.
-	identify new clients and perform related research
-	provide demos of our products to new leads
-	maintain good working relationships with existing and new clients

What do I need?
The ideal candidate will be passionate about having an impact in the developing world, will be a positive and confident communicator with the following skills and experience:
-	3+ years of demonstrable experience in project management
-	BA/BS in business, engineering, or related field; MBA candidates preferred. 
-	A track record of accountability and delivery 
-	Good understanding of business procedures, i.e. finance, forecasting and business planning
-	Ability to manage a varied workload, prioritise accordingly and meet deadlines
-	A high level of numeracy and literacy, with an eye for detail
-	Good IT literacy (MS Office, CRM tools)
Ability to work in the EU

What do we offer you?
We offer a salary of £32-35k where you will have the benefit of flexible working hours and the opportunity to work within a dynamic team. In addition, you’ll get a unique insight into the fast-developing off-grid energy market in Sub-Saharan Africa, on a project with the tangible impact of bringing electricity access to those who need it most. 
We are a close-knit team that is committed to building a sustainable and impactful business at Upya. We want to provide a platform for our team members to work on areas that they are passionate about including travel to and work from developing markets. 
Our culture is open and collaborative, encouraging critical feedback and learning. 

How do I apply?
If you would like to be considered for this opportunity, please write to us at info@Upya.io. Please include your CV and a cover letter explaining why you are interested in the role and why you would be a good fit for the team.

jobs.title: Digital Marketing and Communications Intern
jobs.description:
Are you looking for an opportunity that will test your creative writing, analytical and business skills? 
Would you like to build experience designing and leading social media campaigns? 
Are you passionate about making a positive impact in the developing world?  
If you answered yes to the above, then the Digital Marketing Internship position at Upya may be a good fit for you. 

What does the role involve? 
This is a cross-functional role that will interact regularly with the business development team to support a wide range of business needs. 
You will work on supporting a fast-paced and innovative project in Kenya that is designed to reduce the financial and contractual frictions standing in the way of the electrification of Kenya by giving a wider consumer base access to cheaper, greener and more reliable electricity. 
There will be potential for short-term travel to Kenya to work with our partners on-the-ground in Nairobi and rural areas of Kenya to help implement the project and to support communication and marketing activities including for public announcements. 
You will have the opportunity to lead Upyas brand-building activities including 
-	Designing and implementing social media strategy and managing social media accounts
-	Creating copy for structured blog posts, newsletters and social media
-	Supporting SEO when it comes to content creation and organic acquisition improvements
-	Analysing marketing effectiveness, carrying out A/B testing and SEO analysis
-	Carrying out market research and presenting findings to founders to help shape the overall marketing strategy
The role is defined as a 6-month internship but there will be an opportunity to extend this and create a permanent role depending on performance. 

What do I need?
The ideal candidate will be passionate about having an impact in the developing world with previous experience designing and implementing online marketing activities preferred. Understanding of paid marketing and social media is a bonus 
-	Degree level education in marketing, business or related field 
-	Ability to manage a varied workload, prioritise accordingly and meet deadlines
-	A positive and practical approach to problem solving
-	A high level of numeracy and literacy, with an eye for detail
-	Good IT literacy (MS Office, CRM, social media)
-	Enthusiastic about the start-up environment, the internet and innovation
Ability to work in the EU

What do we offer you?
We offer a salary of £18-20k with the benefit of flexible working hours and the opportunity to work within a dynamic team on projects with a tangible impact. 
You will experience the start-up atmosphere of working on multiple tasks with potential to take on significant responsibility with regard to our marketing decision-making. 
We are a close-knit team that is committed to building a sustainable and impactful business at Upya. We want to provide a platform for our team members to work on areas that they are passionate about including travel to and work from developing markets. 
Our culture is open and collaborative, encouraging critical feedback and learning. 

How do I apply?
If you would like to be considered for this opportunity, please write to us at info@Upya.io. Please include your CV and a cover letter explaining why you are interested in the role and why you would be a good fit for the team.
